title: The Apprentice client refuses to buy penis-shaped lollies
text:

The Apprentice boys don't cover themselves in glory during this week's task when they're ice lollies take on a very rude shape.

Lord Sugar tasks the candidates with creating two original ice lollies - one to pitch to a corporate client and the other to sell to the general public.

After getting a big order for some premium ice lollies the chaps head back to the kitchen to develop their flavours.

But things turn frosty when they produce their milk and raspberry flavoured ice lollies, which have a very rude shape.

Claude Littner is seen turning his nose up at the mixture before having a lick of the premium ice lollies.

(Image: BBC)

(Image: BBC)

As they drive off to meet the corporate client, Ryan-Mark Parsons is forced to admit they made an embarrassing mistake.

He says: "We realise the glitter is invisible. We realise it looks like frozen yoghurt on a stick.

"The lolly looks like a penis. She is expecting something very good. I don't think it's very good. It's mediocre."

(Image: BBC)

(Image: BBC)

When they get there, the stunned corporate client is mortified by the shape of the lollies she is meant to be buying.

She says: "I actually think it looks a little bit rude if I’m being honest. I can't agree with you it's a premium product. I’m just going to leave it here."

The boys try to reduce their price dramatically from £3.85 per lolly to just £1.25, but the client declines their ever decreasing offers.

(Image: BBC)

(Image: BBC)

This comes after the lads get into a very heated argument in the kitchen that threatens to thaw out there lollies.

"That doesn’t look premium does it," admits Dean Ahmad, who got the order with the corporate client.

Furious Riyonn Farsad blames the sales team for not giving them good enough instructions.

(Image: BBC)

He says: "You had a one-on-one with the client who wanted a bespoke lolly. You didn’t come back with a bespoke lolly, you came back with flavours."

Dean shouts back: "I told you to make it premium. Does that look premium?"

Kenna Ngoma is forced to get in the middle and put his hands in front of the rowing pair as he cries "stop".

(Image: BBC)

Riyonn can't believe that the edible glitter and coconut milk "disappeared" when they produced the lolly.

Speaking to camera, Dean says: "I made it categorically clear it was going to be premium. Nothing about that product says premium. It looks cheap and tacky."

Have they ruined their chances in the task?

*The Apprentice airs Wednesdays on BBC One at 9pm
description: The lads get into a heated row when their premium ice lollies for a corporate client end up looking very sexual
